characters.currentChapter: The Memoirs of the Clouded Kokoro
characters.name: Susato Mikotoba
characters.description1: A judicial assistant sent to Britain on a study tour. She's the epitome of a refined Japanese lady and a huge help to me always.

characters.currentChapter: The Memoirs of the Clouded Kokoro
characters.name: Iris Wilson
characters.description1: An extraordinary young girl who lives with Mr Sholmes. She has a degree in medicine and is the author of a popular series of short stories.

characters.currentChapter: The Memoirs of the Clouded Kokoro
characters.name: Herlock Sholmes
characters.description1: There's not a person in the world who hasn't heard of this famous great detective, whose deductions never fail to surprise.

characters.currentChapter: The Memoirs of the Clouded Kokoro
characters.name: Olive Green
characters.description1: An art-school student whose ambition is to become an artist. She's just regained consciousness, having been comatose for days after suffering a stab to from the back.

characters.currentChapter: The Memoirs of the Clouded Kokoro
characters.name: Soseki Natsume
characters.description1: A Japanese scholar sent to London to further his research into the English language. He's just been acquitted of a very serious crime.â†³A Japanese scholar sent to London to further his research into the English language. He's just been acquitted of a very serious crime, but now finds himself accused of another.

characters.currentChapter: The Memoirs of the Clouded Kokoro
characters.name: Tobias Gregson
characters.description1: The detective inspector in charge of Scotland Yard's investigation of the case. He's stern and single-minded in his approach, and a great lover of fish and chips.

characters.currentChapter: The Memoirs of the Clouded Kokoro
characters.name: William Shamspeare
characters.description1: The victim of the current case - a failed actor renting a room in the same building as Mr Natsume's lodgings.

characters.currentChapter: The Memoirs of the Clouded Kokoro
characters.name: John Garrideb
characters.description1: A retired army man who's the landlord of the lodgings rented by the defendant, Mr Natsume. An old knee injury means he's confined to a chair most of the time.

characters.currentChapter: The Memoirs of the Clouded Kokoro
characters.name: Barok van Zieks
characters.description1: A prosecutor known as the Reaper of the Bailey. Supposedly, the souls of those he prosecutes are eternally damned, one way or another.

characters.currentChapter: The Memoirs of the Clouded Kokoro
characters.name: Adron B. Metermann
characters.description1: A young man who works for Altamont Gas. He's a witness to the incident.

characters.currentChapter: The Memoirs of the Clouded Kokoro
characters.name: Quinby Altamont
characters.description1: The wife of the owner of the Altamont Gas Company. She's a staunch believer in the superiority of the fuel and utterly unforgiving of gas theft.

characters.currentChapter: The Memoirs of the Clouded Kokoro
characters.name: Duncan Ross
characters.description1: The love of Miss Green's life, who sadly passed away a month ago as a result of gas poisoning.

evidences.currentChapter: The Memoirs of the Clouded Kokoro
evidences.name: Armband
evidences.description1: An armband I inherited from Kazuma. It identifies the wearer as a defence lawyer throughout the Empire of Japan.

evidences.currentChapter: The Memoirs of the Clouded Kokoro
evidences.name: Secondhand Book Receipt
evidences.description1: A receipt for some books that Mr Natsume purchased at a secondhand bookshop. It was submitted as evidence in the trial the other day.

evidences.currentChapter: The Memoirs of the Clouded Kokoro
evidences.name: Nearby Street Map
evidences.description1: A street map of the neighbourhood where Mr Natsume has his lodgings. It was submitted as evidence in the trial the other day.

evidences.currentChapter: The Memoirs of the Clouded Kokoro
evidences.name: Pair of Teacups
evidences.description1: The teacups used by Mr Shamspeare and Mr Natsume. The one with the green line around the rim was Mr Natsume's.
evidences.description2: The teacups used by Mr Shamspeare and Mr Natsume. There is no tea ring on the inside of Mr Natsume's cup.

evidences.currentChapter: The Memoirs of the Clouded Kokoro
evidences.name: Torn-Off End of Envelope
evidences.description1: A ripped piece of an envelope that was found in Mr Shamspeare's room. The rest of the envelope could not be located.
evidences.description2: A ripped piece of an envelope that was found in Mr Shamspeare's room. It fits perfectly with an envelope in Miss Green's possession.

evidences.currentChapter: The Memoirs of the Clouded Kokoro
evidences.name: Bar of Soap
evidences.description1: A cheap bar of soap that was discovered just outside Mr Shamspeare's window. It's one of two that were found there.
evidences.description2: A cheap bar of soap that was discovered just outside Mr Shamspeare's window. There is a two centimetre diameter circular depression in the middle of one surface.

evidences.currentChapter: The Memoirs of the Clouded Kokoro
evidences.name: Crime Scene Photograph
evidences.description1: A photographic print of the scene taken by police upon their arrival. The victim can be seen unconscious at the table, having been poisoned.

evidences.currentChapter: The Memoirs of the Clouded Kokoro
evidences.name: Victim's Medical Report
evidences.description1: A report issued by Scotland Yard's medical officer. It obviously mentions the poison as well as other details gleaned during the police investigation.

evidences.currentChapter: The Memoirs of the Clouded Kokoro
evidences.name: Gas Meter
evidences.description1: A meter that dispenses gas for a set time after a coin is inserted. It sports a very strong lock, especially with Mr Shamspeare in mind.
evidences.description2: A meter that dispenses gas for a set time after a coin is inserted. The attached coin box sports a very strong lock, and there is a tiny hole in its base.

evidences.currentChapter: The Memoirs of the Clouded Kokoro
evidences.name: Handprints on the Wall
evidences.description1: Traces of handprints on the wall, discovered using the Skin Print Seeker gun. There are multiple prints on either side of a hanging picture.

evidences.currentChapter: The Memoirs of the Clouded Kokoro
evidences.name: Capital Offender Article
evidences.description1: A newspaper article about Selden, a criminal sentenced to receive the death penalty. However, he died of illness in prison whilst his loot remained undiscovered.

evidences.currentChapter: The Memoirs of the Clouded Kokoro
evidences.name: Hidden Photograph
evidences.description1: A photographic print found in Mr Shamspeare's room. It shows the landlord, Mr Garrideb, together with a young man.

evidences.currentChapter: The Memoirs of the Clouded Kokoro
evidences.name: Bottle of Poison
evidences.description1: A bottle found in the possession of Miss Green with traces of the slow-acting poison strychnine inside.

evidences.currentChapter: The Memoirs of the Clouded Kokoro
evidences.name: Capital Offender's File
evidences.description1: Scotland Yard's file about the convicted criminal Selden that includes the newspaper article about him dying of illness in prison.

evidences.currentChapter: The Memoirs of the Clouded Kokoro
evidences.name: Miss Green's Card
evidences.description1: A note in an envelope that seems to have been ripped open rather roughly. It contains instructions to meet with someone who claims to have information about Duncan Ross.
evidences.description2: A note in an envelope that seems to have been ripped open rather roughly. The envelope fits perfectly with a torn-off piece found at the scene of the crime.
